attributes.action: Allow a return to the use of concealed speed cameras.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Speaking as someone who has just suffered a roadrage incident I strongly support a return to hidden cameras, for their potential to get the hotheads off the roads.   

Also, side-streets are being progressively destroyed by ramps, chicanes, bollards and dead-ends, in an ineffectual attempt to control 'rat-runs.' Hidden cameras would achieve safety more cheaply, without the inconvenience. 

Visibility markings were instigated at the behest of the 'performance car' lobby, who argue that high-spec cars remain safe when driven at high speeds.  That is a moot point, but counter-argument is that visible cameras simply do not work.

When hidden cameras were allowed in the 90's, their presence led to a far more civilised driving environment.

A proviso is that hiddden cameras should only be sited at identifiable hazards, and where the maximum speed is clear.
